results.name: Level 1 of Pascal's pyramid. T(n, k) triangle read by rows for n >= 0 and 0 <= k <= n.
comment: Pascal's pyramid is defined by recurrence. P(0) is Pascal's triangle. Now assume P(n-1) already constructed. Then P(n) is found by the steps: (1) Add 1 to each term of P(n-1). (2) Add at the left and at the right side a diagonal consisting all of 1s and complement the top with the rows 1 and 1, 1. A similar construction starting from the Pascal's triangle and subtracting 1 from all terms leads to A014473.
formula: T(n, k) = binomial(n-2, k-1) + 1 if n != 1 else 1.
maple: if k = n then return 1 fi; if k < 2 then return k+1 fi;
xref: Differs from A323231 only in the second term.
